column4: hi, how can I manually add an IP to a url dns resolution in ubuntu 12.04 ?
sudo nano /etc/resolv.conf
or gedit instead of nano if you wish
yes and then?
it has examples
not really
oh?
maybe it was modified before. In any case it says DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE
pfft, that's for wussies
'your changes will be overwritten'
i don't know if ubuntu 12.04 has something special in it then
in any case is that file not related to the dns server ?
try this http://askubuntu.com/questions/130452/how-do-i-add-a-dns-server-via-resolv-conf
what I want is to add an (url,IP) entry so that it doesn't call the dns server, not change the dns server IP
that's not what I want
it's not?
do you want to add something like myfunnyhost.derp so it resolves into any IP you specify?
I want to manually add a url dns resolution, rather than adding a new dns server
yes, that's what resolv.conf was for
If you want to add more entries to /etc/resolv.conf, create a /etc/resolvconf/resolv.conf.d/tail and add them there.
but the question you linked to says 'add a dns server'
hmm
I don't have a dns server to point to, I just want to manually add a IP
